Bloomberg’s Minmin Low breaks down what’s changing, who’s affected, and why it’s causing alarm. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Paytm shares up 17% so far in 2025. Should you ride the rally or wait for a dip?

title: From geopolitical tensions to growth opportunities: Siddhartha Khemka analyses current trends

fullContent: Siddhartha Khemka of MOSL reports a positive Q1 earnings season with 8-9% growth, despite geopolitical tensions. He anticipates improvements following US-Russia talks and RBI's liquidity boost to enhance corporate earnings in the latter half of the fiscal year. Khemka favors financials, domestic consumption, and FMCGs, highlighting strong government capex driving demand in infra and cement sectors.

title: Vishal Mega Mart shares surge 8% after Q1 profit jumps 37% YoY
summary: Vishal Mega Mart's shares experienced a surge following the announcement of robust first-quarter FY26 results. The company's Profit After Tax (PAT) witnessed a substantial 37.2% increase, reaching Rs 206.10 crore, while revenue from operations grew by 21% to Rs 3,140.30 crore.
fullContent: Vishal Mega Mart's shares experienced a surge following the announcement of robust first-quarter FY26 results. The company's Profit After Tax (PAT) witnessed a substantial 37.2% increase, reaching Rs 206.10 crore, while revenue from operations grew by 21% to Rs 3,140.30 crore. This impressive performance reflects the strength of their strategy in providing affordable products to consumers across India.

fullContent: Infosys shares: Infosys will acquire a 75% stake in Versent Group, a wholly owned subsidiary of Australia’s Telstra Group, for AUD 233.25 million (over Rs 1,300 crore).
